Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.localization.localizers

Class TwoWheelLocalizer

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.localization.Localizer
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.localization.localizers.TwoWheelLocalizer
public class TwoWheelLocalizer extends Localizer
This is the TwoWheelLocalizer class. This class extends the Localizer superclass and is a localizer that uses the two wheel odometry with IMU set up. The diagram below, which is modified from Road Runner, shows a typical set up. The view is from the top of the robot looking downwards. left on robot is the y positive direction forward on robot is the x positive direction /--------------\ | ____ | | ---- | | || || | | || || | ----> left (y positive) | | | | \--------------/ | | V forward (x positive)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    TwoWheelLocalizer(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap map)
    This creates a new TwoWheelLocalizer from a HardwareMap, with a starting Pose at (0,0) facing 0 heading.
    TwoWheelLocalizer(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap map, Pose setStartPose)
    This creates a new TwoWheelLocalizer from a HardwareMap and a Pose, with the Pose specifying the starting pose of the localizer.

    • setStartPose

      public void setStartPose(Pose setStart)
      This sets the start pose. Changing the start pose should move the robot as if all its previous movements were displacing it from its new start pose.
      Specified by:
      setStartPose in class Localizer
      Parameters:

      Parameters:
      heading - the rotation of the Matrix

    • setPose

      public void setPose(Pose setPose)
      This sets the current pose estimate. Changing this should just change the robot's current pose estimate, not anything to do with the start pose.
      Specified by:
      setPose in class Localizer
      Parameters:
      setPose - the new current pose estimate

    • update

      public void update()
      This updates the elapsed time timer that keeps track of time between updates, as well as the change position of the Encoders and the IMU readings. Then, the robot's global change in position is calculated using the pose exponential method.
      Specified by:
      update in class Localizer

    • updateEncoders

      public void updateEncoders()
      This updates the Encoders as well as the IMU.

      public void resetEncoders()
      This resets the Encoders.

    • getRobotDeltas

      public Matrix getRobotDeltas()
      This calculates the change in position from the perspective of the robot using information from the Encoders and IMU.
      Returns:
      returns a Matrix containing the robot relative movement.

    • getTotalHeading

      public double getTotalHeading()
      This returns how far the robot has turned in radians, in a number not clamped between 0 and 2 * pi radians. This is used for some tuning things and nothing actually within the following.
      Specified by:
      getTotalHeading in class Localizer
      Returns:
      returns how far the robot has turned in total, in radians.

    • getForwardMultiplier

      public double getForwardMultiplier()
      This returns the multiplier applied to forward movement measurement to convert from encoder ticks to inches. This is found empirically through a tuner.
      Specified by:
      getForwardMultiplier in class Localizer
      Returns:
      returns the forward ticks to inches multiplier

    • getLateralMultiplier
